intro: Paepalanthus pilosus var. microcephalus, commonly known as the small-headed puya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are covered in dense, woolly hairs. The plant produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
